# 1. Company Overview (CW) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Curtiss-Wright Corporation is an American manufacturer and services provider headquartered in Davidson, North Carolina, with factories and operations in and outside the United States. Created in 1929 from the consolidation of Curtiss, Wright, and various supplier companies, the company was immediately the country's largest aviation firm and built more than 142,000 aircraft engines for the U.S. military during World War II. Today, we are a global, integrated provider of highly engineered, technologically advanced products and services. Our revenues are generated by providing our critical solutions through three segments: Aerospace & Industrial, Defense Electronics and Naval & Power, which support several of the largest, most vital industries in the world.

Curtiss-Wright is an integrated business that provides highly engineered products, solutions and services with two-thirds of our sales to Aerospace & Defense (A&D) markets, as well as critical technologies in demanding Commercial Power, Process and Industrial markets. It no longer makes aircraft but still makes many related components, particularly actuators, aircraft controls, valves, and it provides surface-treatment services. It supplies equipment to the commercial, industrial, defense, and energy markets. It makes parts for commercial and naval nuclear power systems, industrial vehicles, and oil- and gas-related machinery.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

The company operates through three primary segments:

**Aerospace & Industrial Segment:**
The Aerospace & Industrial segment offers industrial and specialty vehicle products, such as power management electronics, traction inverters, transmission shifters, and control systems; sensors, controls, and electro-mechanical actuation components used on commercial and military aircraft; and surface technology services Surface treatments, peening and engineered coatings, and material testing to enhance performance and durability

**Defense Electronics Segment:**
The Defense Electronics segment includes Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) embedded computing board-level modules, data acquisition and flight test instrumentation equipment, integrated subsystems, instrumentation and control systems, tactical communications solutions for battlefield network management, and electronic stabilization products, primarily to the defense markets and, to a lesser extent, the commercial aerospace market.

**Naval & Power Segment:**
The Naval and Power segment primarily provides solutions to the naval defense and power and process markets, including naval propulsion equipment, main coolant pumps, motors, generators, steam turbines, valves, and secondary propulsion systems, as well as a diversified offering of products for commercial nuclear power plants and nuclear equipment manufacturers, and specialized severe-service valve technologies to energy and industrial markets.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Strategic Partnership with Rolls-Royce SMR:**
Curtiss-Wright Corporation (NYSE: CW) today announced that its UK-based Curtiss-Wright Nuclear business (formerly Ultra Energy) signed a multi-million dollar strategic partnership with Rolls-Royce SMR to deliver critical safety systems for its Small Modular Reactor (SMR) technology. Under the contract, Curtiss-Wright will provide design, qualification, testing and supply of the non-programmable diverse Reactor Protection Systems for a global fleet of Rolls-Royce SMRs.

**Green Hills Software Partnership:**
Curtiss-Wright will develop, market and support board support packages (BSPs) and core drivers for the latest versions of the INTEGRITY real-time operating system using MULTI development tools provided by Green Hills under the partnership agreement. Support for INTEGRITY will be available for selected Curtiss-Wright VME and VPX/VPX-REDI single-board computers, including the popular SVME/DMV-183, and digital signal processor (DSP) engines.

**XM30 Combat Vehicle Program:**
Curtiss-Wright Corporation (NYSE: CW) today announced that it has been selected by American Rheinmetall to provide its Turret Drive Stabilization System (TDSS) for the prototype phase of the U.S. Army's XM30 Combat Vehicle (CV) program, which was recently approved to advance to Milestone B, the Engineering and Manufacturing Development (EMD) phase.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Our Pivot to Growth strategy is centered on a renewed drive for top line acceleration through both organic and inorganic sales growth, building on the strengths across our A&D and Commercial markets, deepening and expanding our customer relationships by driving One Curtiss-Wright to the customer, and maintaining our disciplined approach to acquisitions. Since 2021, we have increased our focus on collaboration and innovation, while leveraging the critical mass of One Curtiss-Wright across the enterprise, to identify and unlock new sources of value for our customers. Further, our team has proven extremely capable of managing through the global supply chain challenges and inflationary impacts on our business, strengthening our leading market positions and driving increased efficiency across our global operations which remain critical to the Company's long-term success.

Our goal is to be #1 or #2 in all our key end markets, to be the trusted "go to" company in solving the most difficult engineering problems within specific specialties or solutions. We pride ourselves in maintaining long-standing customer relationships, which should continue to propel us further into leading positions. We are focused on protecting and expanding market share to ensure that we maintain appropriate mass and scale to realize the synergies and efficiencies necessary to achieve steady operating margin expansion.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Results:**
Reported sales of $869 million, up 9%, operating income of $166 million, operating margin of 19.1%, and diluted earnings per share (EPS) of $3.31; Adjusted operating income of $170 million, up 14%; Adjusted operating margin of 19.6%, up 90 basis points; Free cash flow (FCF) of $176 million, generating 137% FCF conversion.

**Full-Year 2025 Guidance (Raised):**
Sales guidance increased to new range of 10% to 11% growth (previously 9% to 10%), which continues to reflect growth in the majority of Curtiss-Wright's end markets; Operating income guidance increased to new range of 16% to 19% growth (previously 15% to 18%); Operating margin guidance range of 18.5% to 18.7%, up 100 to 120 basis points compared with the prior year; Diluted EPS guidance increased to new range of $12.95 to $13.20, now up 19% to 21% (previously $12.70 to $13.00, up 16% to 19%)

**2025 Performance:**
Curtiss-Wright revenue for the quarter ending September 30, 2025 was $0.869B, a 8.79% increase year-over-year. Curtiss-Wright revenue for the twelve months ending September 30, 2025 was $3.376B, a 9.51% increase year-over-year.

**Order Growth and Backlog:**
New orders of $927 million increased 8% compared with the prior year and generated an overall book-to-bill of approximately 1.1x, principally driven by continued strong demand in the commercial aerospace and commercial nuclear markets; and · Backlog of $3.9 billion, up 14% from December 31, 2024, reflecting higher demand in both our A&D and Commercial markets.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

Moog, Kaman, L3 Harris Technologies, Parker-Hannifin, and ITT are some of the 78 competitors of Curtiss-Wright. Curtiss-Wright's main competitors include Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings, AIDC, KNDS, 14th Research Institute of CETC, Magellan Aerospace and Moog. Rockwell Collins, now a part of Collins Aerospace, is a direct competitor to Curtiss-Wright in the aerospace and defense markets, particularly in avionics and integrated systems. Both companies aim to provide advanced technological solutions, but Rockwell Collins benefits from the extensive resources and supply chain of its parent company, Raytheon Technologies, giving it a competitive edge in integrated defense systems. Thales Group is a French multinational that competes with Curtiss-Wright in aerospace and defense sectors, particularly in avionics and command and control systems.

Curtiss-Wright differentiates itself through specialized niche markets, particularly nuclear propulsion systems where few competitors exist, and through its integrated One Curtiss-Wright approach.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Major Acquisitions:**
Curtiss-Wright Corporation (NYSE: CW) today announced that it has completed the acquisition of Ultra Nuclear Limited and Weed Instrument Co., Inc. ("Ultra Energy") for $200 million in cash. Ultra Energy is a leading global provider of safety-critical measurement and control systems to the Commercial Nuclear and Aerospace & Defense markets. The business designs and manufactures reactor protection systems, neutron monitoring systems, radiation monitoring systems, and temperature and pressure sensors that facilitate the safe and reliable operation of commercial nuclear reactors and other power generation plants.

**Strategic Partnerships:**
- Rolls-Royce SMR partnership for reactor protection systems
- Green Hills Software partnership for COTS computing platforms
- American Rheinmetall collaboration on XM30 Combat Vehicle

## 12. Recent Developments

**Q3 2025 Strong Performance:**
In the third quarter, Curtiss-Wright continued to deliver strong results under our Pivot to Growth strategy, with higher revenues and growth in operating income across all three segments. We achieved adjusted operating margin of 19.6%, mid-teens growth in diluted EPS and improved free cash flow generation. We also demonstrated solid order growth of 8%, yielding an overall book-to-bill of 1.1x. Based on our strong year-to-date performance, we have raised our full-year guidance for sales, operating income and diluted EPS.

**Share Repurchase Program Expansion:**
In addition, we recently expanded our 2025 share repurchase program, targeting a new record in annual share repurchases of more than $450 million. This return of capital to shareholders reflects the Company's confident outlook and demonstrates our commitment to leveraging our strong balance sheet in support of disciplined capital allocation.

Based on the company's strong fundamentals, growth trajectory, strategic positioning, and execution of its growth strategy, the fair value estimate is 8-13% above current trading levels. The company appears well-positioned for continued strong performance, making it an attractive investment for portfolios seeking growth with moderate risk appetite in the aerospace, defense, and nuclear sectors.
tldr_summary:
Curtiss-Wright Corporation is a global manufacturer of highly engineered products and services primarily serving aerospace, defense, and industrial markets, with a strong focus on critical technological solutions across multiple sectors.

The company has demonstrated robust growth through its "Pivot to Growth" strategy, targeting market leadership in aerospace, nuclear power, and defense electronics. Key strategic moves include a multi-million dollar partnership with Rolls-Royce SMR for small modular reactor safety systems and selection for the U.S. Army's XM30 Combat Vehicle program. With a diversified portfolio spanning naval propulsion, commercial nuclear systems, and defense electronics, Curtiss-Wright maintains competitive advantages in specialized niche markets. Recent acquisitions and strong order backlog ($3.9B, up 14%) underscore its market positioning, while consistent financial performance with double-digit revenue growth and expanding operating margins signal strategic execution.

With an AI investment rating of 8.2/10 and a fair value range of $715-$750, the stock offers attractive growth potential in high-barrier technological markets with moderate investment risk.
